required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics & Pharmacodynamics of JS001 for Patients With Recurrent Malignant Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Study of Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Multiple Doses of Recombinant Humanized Anti-PD-1 Monoclonal Antibody for Injection in Patients With Recurrent Malignant Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective is to assess the safety and tolerability of JS-001 in subjects with recurrent malignant lymphoma, and to evaluate its preliminary efficacy.
The secondary objectives are to: 1) characterize the single-dose and multi-dose pharmacokinetic (PK) profile of JS-001, 2) characterize the immunogenicity of JS-001; 3) assess the dose-efficacy relationship of JS-001 single agent, and 4) preliminarily evaluate biomarkers associated with the efficacy of JS-001.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.0

secondary_outcome.measure: correlation analysis of PD-L1 expression of tumor
Objective Response Rate (ORR) by irRC and RECIST 1.1

arm_group.description: humanized anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody is to be injected intravenously 1mg/kg Q2w until disease progresses or unacceptable tolerability occurs
humanized anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody is to be injected intravenously 3mg/kg Q2w until disease progresses or unacceptable tolerability occurs
humanized anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody is to be injected intravenously 10mg/kg Q2w until disease progresses or unacceptable tolerability occurs

intervention.description: Dose escalation study evaluating three dose levels (1, 3 and 10 mg/kg) of JS001. Subjects will be assigned to a dose schedule in the order of study entry.

overall_official.affiliation: Blood Diseases Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences

facility.name: Blood Diseases Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences
